body.p:
To
His Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Govenor of the State of Kentucky

Dear Sir -- We the undersigned, citizens of Caldwell County Ky. have long known Thomas. B. Wadlington, and he has ever been considered a good & true hearted citizen, Known & noted, for his industry & his orderly conduct -- The difficulty in which he was engaged with M. A. Cartwright did not appear to us to be of his own seeking, nor are we satisfied, nor do we believe that -- the case was fairly presented to the Jury as it actually occurred. We hope your Excellency will review the case, and give the poor man the benefit of every doubt & we desire that his case may be judged of with mercy & regarded with favor. And that your Excellency will take into consideration every circumstance that ought to operate in his behalf -- And we desire that your Excellency may & will be persuaded that it is consistent with your duty to extend to him Executive Clemency & that his life may be spared either by a full pardon or a commutation of his punishment --

Yours respectfully --
James Perry
Wylie Perry
Foster Mason
Richard, Pemberton, Jr
Richard Pemberton
W W Pemberton
J W Wylie
J C Stevens

State of Kentucky Caldwell County
Charles W Wadlington
Says he was personally present when each of the above named persons Signed the foregoing Petition
Sworn to before me by Charles W Wadlington this Jany 28th 1861
